item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th January
item.description:
email rcvd 22.01.24 - By way of brief introduction, CBRE are appointed as agents to act on behalf of the landlords of 33/41 The Promenade, Cheltenham. During a recent site inspection, it was noted that the trees (highlighted in the attached plan) branches are very close to and in certain instances touching the building. Given the potential implications upon the fabric of the building, could you please arrange for the trees in questions to be cut back so that there is no danger of damage being caused to the building or its occupants. For reference, the red box highlights 33/41 The Prom and you can clearly see that there are branches close to / touching the buildings, Please let me know if you need any more information and if you could please keep me updated as you progress it would be much appreciated, Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th January
item.description:
Tree damage from storm Isha, with a significant branch mostly broken from the trunk of the tree and now in the garden of 59 Arle Gardens. See attached photo.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th January
item.description:
email rcvd 23.01.24 - To Whom it may concern: This is to follow my report few months ago, regarding the tree planted in front of 99 Orchard Avenue, Cheltenham GL517ND. Last storm it has already fallen Hitting the fence, I try to fix it by putting a support which I reported it is temporary and the Borough should look into it giving the option of taking it down permanently since the roots did not penetrate deep and it won't be long it will come off. Or put a support burried deep besides it. Last night storm it leaning again towards my fence, if not for the support I made it could have damaged or hurt somebody. Once again, I request that you look on this matter before its to late.
Report on FixMyStreet
